title: Chapter 7 bankruptcy. Want to discharge money owed to Bail Bondsman. Do they have preferable treatment? other issues?
question: Just wondering, I am still paying of their 10% fee. The underlying criminal case is resolved. Are there any pitfalls with trying to discharge this particular kind of debt?
question_tags: Business contracts,Bankruptcy,Chapter 7 bankruptcy,Bankruptcy petition,Bankruptcy documents,Debt,Secured debt,Debt discharge,Bankruptcy and debt,Bail bonds for criminal charges,State, local, and municipal law
answers: Ms. Bunce provided the correct answer. I would add that if there was a co-signer the co-signer might not be very happy with your discharge of the debt.
Only if you or someone on your behalf posted collateral on the bond. The right to collateral could make this a secured debt. Hope this perspective helps!
Speak with a bankruptcy attorney in your area. State law would apply. If you showed up for court and the criminal case was taken care of then the 10% will go to the bail bonds business.
